title: Has religion reconciled with science? - Quora

response.answer_text: By religion I assume you refer to the Christian concept of a Creator of all things—right? God, our Creator, does not need to reconcile with anything or anyone ! The question should be: Has science reconciled with its Creator?—and the answer is an resounding YES. Of course, scientists, the people who do science, might have problems about the existence of their Creator—but that is not HIS fault. However, scientists today will always follow the facts where they lead so, while scientists peruse the volumes of data on NDE experiences handed to them by doctors, and examine DNA, some are already concluding that “where science ends spirituality begins” —which was spoken by Dr. Mary Neal, former Head of spine surgery at the University of Southern California.

Religion and Science aren’t individual minds. There’s a wide range of perceptions. Some religious people embrace science. Some religious people reject any science that contradicts their religious beliefs. Some scientists are religious. Some scientists reject religious beliefs because they have no proper basis in fact. It’s certainly impossible to validate religious beliefs as having scientific validity. Any thing identified as religious belief that was validated as science would in practice become recognised as science and people would stop referring to those things as religious belief. Most people recognise religious beliefs vary from person to person but good science is as close objective fact as can be synthesised. That inevitably means that if people seek to justify their beliefs having them recognised as science will have them accepted by the widest audience. In that sense where it is possible science ‘drives out religion’ including the God of the gaps phenomenon that if science has an answer for most people religious answers are abandoned. Some religious beliefs are cultural values that aren’t of a nature that could be validated scientifically. But religious beliefs about supposed objective truths can be seen as beliefs that can’t be justified as knowledge.

“Has religion reconciled with science? Of course not! Judging by some of these answers, religion is intellectually stumbling around trying to explain supernatural events in a scientific context where the supernatural is so totally unnatural it has never been scientifically documented. One answer claims that science has not reconciled with itself. That’s because science is a ruthless process of discovery…not a fixed repository of unproven beliefs. Science is way more honest than religion…because it will openly tell everyone what it does not know. Religion seizes on the honest admissions of science in order to discredit science for working the way it was designed to work. Science is about discovery…religion is about reinforcing that which science has long made obsolete. Religion will go on…but as a source of usable information about reality, it has been displaced by science. Religion will never recover.

***Hinduism and Science*** Please read below The most complex Hollywood sci-fi movie concepts were well known to us atleast Thousands years back! In a part of the movie Interstellar of Nolan, astronauts went to some Miller planet (orbiting a Gargantuan system) on which 9 hours on the planet are equivalent to 63 years on earth. Astronauts also lost one of the crew member there (named Doyle).  A similar story is mentioned in many Hindu scriptures including Mahabharata, Harivansh Purana, Devi-Bhagvata, related to time travel.  Kakudmi was the king of Kusasthali (ancient name of Dwarka, Gujarat). Beauty of Kakudmi’s daughter Revati made him think that no one is eligible enough to marry his daughter, so along-with his daughter he went to Lord Brahma to seek his advice about a suitable husband for Revati. When they arrived Brahma was listening to the musical performance by the Ghandarvas, so both of them waited patiently untill the performance ended. Then they humbly asked Brahma for help and to select anyone from the shortlisted candidates. Upon which, Brahma laughed and explained that, time runs differently on different planes of existence, and that during the short time they had waited in Brahma-loka to see him, 27 chatur-yugas ( 108 yugas or age of man ) had passed on earth and all those persons whom Kakudmi shortlisted are died in course of time, even son and grandsons of those people’s died too. And also he is now all alone and all his friends, ministers, wives, kinsmen, treasures, armies swept away by the hand of time. King Kakudmi was overcome with astonishment and alarm at hearing this news. However, Brahma comforted him, and added that Lord Vishnu was currently incarnate on earth in the forms of Krishna and Balrama, and he recommended Balarama as a husband for Revati. Kakudmi along-with his daughter then returned to earth which they regarded as having left only just a short while ago. They were shocked by the changes that had taken place. Not only had the landscape and environment changed, but over the intervening 27 chatur-yugas, in the cycles of human spiritual and cultural evolution, mankind was at a lower level of development than in their own time .

Because science has surpassed religious ideology in accurately describing what the world is and how it works, there appears in some peoples’ minds that it is a competition, a contest for which system can provide the best answers to our questions on reality. They are two completely different realms; science is about knowledge and religion is about faith. There is no overlap; that is forced, most likely because some religious people are attracted to science and some scientists are still attracted to religion. What has happened in the evolution of the religion narrative is that as science makes advances in knowledge, religious ideology must retreat, moving the goal posts, so to speak. For example, first we all thought that thunder and lightning was the result of angry gods up in the clouds, pissed off at us, again, for some perceived transgressions. Now we know that thunder and lightning are caused by electrons moving around. So the role of God or gods moves from human-like beings dwelling in clouds to occupying the entire sky. At some point there will no longer be any use for religion based explanations of physical reality; then it will be confined to a form of psychotherapy, a pile of words to comfort us in our endless suffering.

There Is was never any arguement between real science and in my case the judeo christian religion, the only arguement is through the lies spread by anti Christian fud masters. Much like the shorts who spread lies to devalue a company (ie tesla) the lies spread by the anti Christian world view has shoved down many people throats the mytj that the Bible and science are enemies and nothing could be further from the truth as this short free booklet will demonstrate. http://www.bibletruthrestored.org/old/media/DIR_12301/83ca380579d8d955ffff8275ffffe41e.pdf The Bible teaches us to prove all things and that includes the bibles claims.

Science is the process of arduous testing to determine how things work. What’s to reconcile? Are there really people who think that depending on things to work the way they have ALWAYS worked in the past is not valid? This morning I put sugar in my coffee and it tasted sweet as it has for the last 50 years. My informal scientific theory is that sugar sweetens coffee and the same thing will happen tomorrow. If you operate differently, I don’t know how you navigate life.

I don’t think your question has an answer, nor should it necessarily. Science and religion are completely separate pursuits, with a different set of operating principles. There is not a shred of judgement in that previous statement, it just is. It’s like asking if your local grocery store has reconciled with McDonalds. Whattt?????

Has religion reconciled with science? Religion is made up by men telling each other what to do. It can be anything. It does not need to reconcile with any other field of study. It does not need to be right or logical or anything else. It is simply men telling each other what to do.
Reconciled? Scientific progress keeps illustrating that religious dogmata tend to be nothing short of ridiculous.
Does religion conflict with science? If god created the universe and science is based on observations of how the universe works, then god created the sciences.
It’s more like religion has been proven incorrect by science. At best, religion has a “agree to disagree” mentality over being disproven.
Most denominations have. The evangelicals haven’t, and are still trying to prove science wrong, without any scientific knowledge to do it with.
They were never even in conflict.
